examples: be diverted The course of the stream has now been diverted.
be diverted (from something) (to/into/onto something) Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.

meanings.def: to use money, materials, etc. for a different purpose from their original purpose
examples: be diverted (from something) (to/into something) More of the budget was diverted into promotions.

meanings.def: to take somebody’s thoughts or attention away from something
examples: divert somebody/something (away) from something The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
divert somebody/something (from something) to/onto something She managed to divert the baby onto a different activity.
be diverted Children are easily diverted.
